content: Compose a limerick about kangaroos in the style of Dr. Seuss.

In the land where the sun shines so bright,
Live creatures that hop through the night.
With pouches so deep,
They've got room to keep,
Their young ones safe and tight.

But one kangaroo, oh so sly,
Decided to try something new.
He put on a tutu,
And started to do,
A dance that was quite a sight!

He hopped and he twirled, with such glee,
Under the moon's silvery sheen.
His friends gathered round,
Watching him astound,
With moves that were simply serene.

"Dear kangaroo," they all said,
"Why such a peculiar tread?"
He grinned with a twinkle,
"In this land of theinkel,
We can be who we dream to be!"

So remember, dear friends, near and far,
That in life, there's room for a star.
To hop or to dance,
To take a new chance,
For dreams are what make us who we are.
